title: Tacos med oksekød, tomatsalsa og avocado

The available options like 'taco shells', 'salsa, hot', 'crayfish, raw', and 'tortilla chips, cheese' are not suitable broader categories or synonyms for 'fajita crawling' (which likely refers to a spice mix or seasoning), violating rule 1 and 2. instructions:
Peel and chop the onion and garlic, and cut the peppers into cubes. Heat a scoop of oil on a pan and saute both in it in even heat until the onions are clear. Turn up the flame and now brown the meat on the same pan. Add spices and pepper, and fry for a few minutes. Come on tomato puree, kidney beans and beef fund and simmer for 10-15 minutes until the moisture is almost evaporated. Taste with salt and pepper and possibly extra chili.
Put your tortillas in a pack of silver paper and whine them in a 200 degree hot oven for approx. 10 minutes.
Distribute the lightning chili on your tacos, preferably at the table, and top with tomato salsa and avocado. Serve if necessary. With extra lime and hot sauce (eg Tabasco or similar) to those who prefer it extra strongly.
Fresh tomato salsa with chili and coriander
Peel and chop onion and garlic. Chop the tomatoes into coarse cubes and finely chop the chili pepper. Cut the coriander. Mix it all together with olive oil, lime juice, salt and pepper.
